lines.text: We're all living on the promise of autumn.
It's a pretty tough life for a woman without a man.
It's a hard life, Mr. Douglas, with or without a man.
Today I shot a rabbit. Oh, I felt so triumphant. Until Mr. Douglas rode up. He, of course, had shot a large, fat antelope.
Hey Mrs. Sergeant... If you put your foot in here I'll help you up and give you a ride home.

[voice-over]
So it was that Mr. Douglas brought me home.
John dreamt of a promise in this land. Now that promise is ours. For I know myself an alien here no more. Tomorrow, all our tomorrows, will be busy days.
